So, exactly why do you think diversity is bad?
you are so wrong
- Diversity is fine as long as you aren’t making decisions based on race/gender.
So, when you have two candidates for a job who have the same qualifications, how would you suggest companies decide which one to hire?
Nathan
- I have never met two people who were exactly the same. If I did, race would be the last thing I would base the decision on.
I didn't say they were exactly the same; I said their qualifications were the same. If you wouldn't decide based on race, than what would you base your decision on?
- I would hire the person who didn’t remind me of you.
So, you don't really have an argument against diversity, equality, and inclusion. You're simply parroting what Fox News told you.

- I’m not white and I’m just not going to argue with a crusty old white woman. I’ll allow you permission to have final reply, I get the feeling you are like that. As a added bonus, there are only 2 genders, men can’t get pregnant and trans men aren’t women.
o on the color of their skin!
That's the point. Trans men aren't women, they're men. Way to go ally

I never said you were white. You're in no position to give me permission to do anything. And it's clear you know nothing about the actual practices used when prioritizing diversity, equality, and inclusion. A quick primer: Applicants' resumes are scrubbed of all info that could indicate race, gender, age, handicap, orientation, and other diversity, equality, and inclusion related information. If, after the hiring managers review the resumes, two or more candidates are virtually identical, then their other identifying information is made know. That allows the hiring managers to take a look at their staffing for areas that could use improvement and make decisions that make the company more representative of the community it serves.
Anti-civil rights for ALL Americans, eh?
One thing we can agree on is that trans men are men.

Costco’s new management and plan seems to be to make as much money as possible. Some of their offerings have doubled in price since Covid and aren’t going down. Their gas in my town is $0.25 more per gallon than the Costco in the next town, which is crazy. Apparently, they go by local gas prices instead of what they can charge members without the gouge. At least they kept DEI in place… The jury is still out.
Our gas is more than the next town over due to county taxes. Check it out. Costco gas is always much cheaper than even the bargain places here…$0.54 less this week.
Ellen, my subject was the differing cost of Costco gas stations in the same small county.

Guelzo wrote that “for all his complaining, no one since Andrew Jackson played with the federal patronage system more vigorously than Lincoln. Of the 1,520 federal offices directly under president control, Lincoln emptied nearly 1,200 of them of Democrats after his election to replace them with Republicans. If he hesitated to appear as a ‘military chieftain,’ he had no qualms about appearing as a political one. Although ‘it had been the policy of successful administration to make sweeping changes of opponents,’ Gideon Welles wrote, ‘the President and some of the Cabinet, particularly the Secretary of State, were disposed to go beyond others in these respects.’ The war would serve to quintuple the number of civilian patronage jobs in the government, from 40,000 in the entire network of federal employment to nearly 195,000 by the war’s end, and all of them would become plums for Republican party loyalists.”
